subject: Investing
title: Dividend Reinvestment Plans (DRIPs)
description: Learn Dividend Reinvestment Plans (DRIPs) in one minute.

hook.text: A teacher set up a DRIP in 1985 and never added another dollar. By 2020, her account had grown fifteenfold.

buildup.text: A DRIP automatically reinvests your cash dividends into additional shares of the same stock.

discovery.text: Most brokers offer free DRIPs with fractional shares, so every cent of your dividend works immediately.

twist.text: Even with reinvestment, dividends are usually taxable in the year they're paid. Plan for the tax bill.

climax.text: DRIPs are ideal during the accumulation phase. Switch to cash payouts when you need the income.

punchline.text: Drip by drip, shares multiply. That's the quiet power of reinvestment.

quiz.question: What does a DRIP do?
options: Automatically reinvests dividends into more shares
